model

Class GifConstructor

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.GifConstructor

  • public class GifConstructor
extends java.lang.Object
    The GifConstructor class interacts with lieng.GIFWriter and sends all necessary information in order to create a gif of the current pattern or board. It sets all necessary variables gotten from the export controller and performs the necessary calculations to successfully create a gif.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GifConstructor(GameOfLife gol, int iterations, int fps, boolean entireBoardBool, javafx.scene.paint.Color backgroundColor, javafx.scene.paint.Color cellColor, int size)
      Sole constructor for a GifConstructor object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • GifConstructor

        public GifConstructor(GameOfLife gol,
                      int iterations,
                      int fps,
                      boolean entireBoardBool,
                      javafx.scene.paint.Color backgroundColor,
                      javafx.scene.paint.Color cellColor,
                      int size)
        Sole constructor for a GifConstructor object. Sets all needed parameters to create a GifConstructor object.
        Parameters:
        gol - The GameOfLife object to be considered.
        iterations - The number of iterations to create a gif with.
        fps - The number of images per seconds to produce.
        entireBoardBool - Boolean representing whether to draw the entire board, or just the active pattern.
        backgroundColor - The background color to be drawn in the gif.
        cellColor - The color of the cells to be drawn in the gif.
        size - The size of the gif in pixels.
        See Also:
        gifGol, gifBoard, counter, milliseconds, drawEntireBoard, gifBackgroundColor, gifCellColor, gifSize

    • Method Detail

      • exportGif

        public void exportGif(java.lang.String filePath)
        Method that exports a gif to file by creating a new GIFWriter and calling the writeGoLSequenceToGif method. Catches an IOException if thrown, and shows a popup to the user explaining what went wrong.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The filepath to write the new file in.
        See Also:
        writeGoLSequenceToGIF(GIFWriter, GameOfLife, int, java.awt.Color), PopUpAlerts.ioeSaveError(), GIFWriter.GIFWriter(int, int, String, int), GIFWriter.setBackgroundColor(java.awt.Color)
